body_html:
I built the library manually for different cpu architectures as I mentioned in my earlier comment to add the missing op, after that i added the library to my project. my project structure looks like this :
(the libraries should be placed in the libs directory in your project)

--jniLibs
----arm64-v8
--------libtensorflow_inference.so
----armeabi-v7a
--------libtensorflow_inference.so
----x86
--------libtensorflow_inference.so
----x86_64
--------libtensorflow_inference.so
----libandroid_tensorflow_inference_java.jar

you should download the libandroid_tensorflow_inference_java.jar from the last successful nightlybuild referenced in their Object Detection Demo Readme but I don't know why for about a month now the link don't work anymore. Try to open a new issue about it, because I can't attach it here and I don't know if there is a new link for it.

you need to add this to your gradle file :

android{
...
    sourceSets {
        main {
            jniLibs.srcDirs = ['libs']
        }
    }
...
}

all of this will basically replace this line :
implementation 'org.tensorflow:tensorflow-android:+'
so after adding the libraries delete that line to avoid conflict. And that should be it

body:
I built the library manually for different cpu architectures as I mentioned in my earlier comment to add the missing `op`, after that i added the library to my project. my project structure looks like this : 
(the libraries should be placed in the `libs` directory in your project)

> --jniLibs
> ----arm64-v8
> --------libtensorflow_inference.so
> ----armeabi-v7a
> --------libtensorflow_inference.so
> ----x86
> --------libtensorflow_inference.so
> ----x86_64
> --------libtensorflow_inference.so
> ----libandroid_tensorflow_inference_java.jar

you should download the `libandroid_tensorflow_inference_java.jar` from the last successful [nightlybuild](https://ci.tensorflow.org/view/Nightly/job/nightly-android/) referenced in their Object Detection Demo Readme but I don't know why for about a month now the link don't work anymore. Try to open a new issue about it, because I can't attach it here  and I don't know if there is a new link for it.

you need to add this to your gradle file : 

```
android{
...
    sourceSets {
        main {
            jniLibs.srcDirs = ['libs']
        }
    }
...
}
```
all of this will basically replace this line : 
`implementation 'org.tensorflow:tensorflow-android:+'`
so after adding the libraries delete that line to avoid conflict. And that should be it
